review_blob:
Draught at CBF Wien.
Dark amber, hazy body, with a massive, stable, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma with a lot of raspberries, some bread, subtle honey.
Taste also with lots of distinctive sweet and sour raspberries, bread, some grass, some honey.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes very fruity again, with raspberriey mainly and some honey.

Very nice. This is all about the raspberries, which are very distinctive. Really quaffable and fresh. Lovely fruit beer.

Sampled from bottle at CBF Wien.
Dark copper body, with almost no head.
Aroma of barrel, red wine, overripe fruits, leather, dried fruits, cherries, vanilla, some barnyard.
Taste follows this, with even more lovely barrel notes.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with almost no carbonation.
Finishes smooth, wooden, vinous, sweet and sour fruity, with a bit vanilla.

Really tasty. Smooth and complex, with lovely, well integrated barrel notes and lots of fruits. Im just missing a bit more carbonation. But overall still one of the very best style examples from Austria so far!

Draught at CBF Wien.
Black body, with a big, dense, creamy, coffee-colored head. 
Aroma with loads of coffee beans and espresso, cocoa, some dark chocolate, subtle dark fruits.
Taste follows this pretty much.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty, moderate sweet, with lots of coffee again.

Tasty. Straight, really smooth and quite easy to drink, with lots of lovely, direct coffee notes. Not very complex, but a great Stout for coffee lovers like me.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Amber-orange, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, slightly yellowish head.
Aroma of banana, citrus, cloves, bread, vanilla.
Tastes of banana, dried fruits, citrus, mango, some passion fruit, bread, some vanilla, spices.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes fruity, medium sweet, a bit spicy, with a slight fruity sourness, a bit bready, a bit yeasty.

Nice one. The nose is quite boring, but the taste is nice, with a good mix of the typical Weizen aromas and fruity hoppy notes, reminding me a bit of the famous Hopfenweisse from Schneider Weisse. Overall not on par with the Hopfenweisse at all, but still a quaffable, hoppy Weizenbock.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, yellowish head.
Aroma of citrus, passion fruit, apricot, orange, biscuit.
Taste follows this, with some more earthy notes.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, a bit dry, fruity, citric, a bit yeasty, a bit sweet malty.

Very nice. Straight, clean and quite easy, with lovely fruit notes. Greatly balanced, with just enough bitterness and malt body. Another really enjoyable beer by this brewery, which is my favourite one from Slovakia at the moment.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Golden, clear body, with a medium, creamy, off-white head.
Aroma of flowers, hay, bread, citrus, honey.
Tastes of honey, flowers, bread, grains, citrus, some herbs.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, a bit sweet, a bit dry, floral, grassy, citric, a bit herbal.

Nice one. Drinks quite easy and fresh, with really nice floral notes and a good balance, with enough sweetness. Really good, quaffable lager beer, although not much bock beer character.

Sampled from bottle at CBF Wien.
Golden-amber, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.
Really fresh aroma of barrel, sour citrus, lemongrass, mint, green apples, some barnyard.
Taste is even better, also very fresh, with the same aromas and some more pears.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes fresh, sour, citric, wooden, fruity, with some pears and apples.

Very tasty! Perfectly balanced, drinks so fresh, with just the right amount of sourness. Lovely combination of barrel notes and various fruits. Among my favourite sour ales Ive had so far, I could drink this all day long.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, creamy, a bit yellowish head.
Aroma of citrus, grass, pine, orange, apricot, some tropical fruits, some biscuit.
Taste follows this, with some more grapefruit.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, medium dry, zesty, grassy, piney, fruity.

Very nice. Drinks really easy and fresh, with crisp fruity and grassy hops and just enough malt body. Really good, sessionable APA.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Deep copper body, with a medium, creamy, pink head.
Aroma with lots of sweet berries, bubblegum, vanilla.
Tastes of sweet and sour berries, apples, some pears, vanilla.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes medium sour, a bit sweet, fruity, with apples and berries.

Nice one. The nose is a bit flat, but the taste is nice, with lots of fruits. A bit simple overall maybe and I was hoping for a bit more blueberries, but still an enjoyable fruit beer.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Amber, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, white head.
Aroma of cheese, barnyard, green apples, some pears, some citrus, yeast.
Tastes of green apples, pears, citrus, cheese, some grains.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, a bit bitter, fruity, with apples and pears mainly.

Very good, especially considering the low ABV. Drinks really fresh and easy, with lots of fruits and a well balanced sourness. Propably my favourite beer by this brewery so far.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Black body, with a small, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of grapefruit, orange, resin, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, some liquorice.
Tastes of coffee, cocoa, vanilla, citrus, orange, passion fruit, some grass.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes roasty, citric, fruity, with cocoa and some vanilla.

Nice one. Nothing special overall, typical BIPA, but well balanced and quite easy drinkable. Not among my favourite style examples from Austria though.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Black body, with a medium, dense, very creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of vanilla, cocoa, coffee, some liquorice, sweet fruits.
Taste follows this, quite sweet and smooth, but with a bit more roastiness.
Medium, very creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes roasty, medium bitter, also a bit sweet, a bit dry, with lots of cocoa, coffee, bitter chocolate, hops, some liquorice, some alcoholy warmth.

Very nice. A bit more on the sweet side, very smooth and creamy, greatly hiding the ABV. Not a world-class style example maybe, but really pleasant.

Sampled from bottle at CBF Wien.
Straw colored, clear body, with a tiny, creamy, off-white head.
Aroma of green apples, lemongrass, spices, funk, flowers.
Taste follows this, with some more minty notes.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes sour, fruity, grassy, a bit spicy.

Nice one. Quite unique and refreshing, with a moderated sourness and an interesting mix of apples and grassy notes. Not my favourite sour beer by this brewery, but enjoyable nonetheless.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Amber, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of grapefruit, citrus, orange, passion fruit, apricot, vanilla, some biscuit.
Taste follows this, with some more pine and slight peppery notes.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes bitter, a bit dry, zesty, resinous, piney, fruity, slightly malty.

Really tasty. A crisp fruit bomb, with lots of lovely citric and tropical fruit notes and just enough malt body. Greatly balanced, with the right level of bitterness and sweetness and easy drinkable. My favourite beer by this brewery so far and among my favourite IPAs from Austria!
beer_name: Next Level Brewing High Diver - India Pale Ale

review_blob:
Sampled from bottle at CBF Wien.
Honey golden, hazy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, white head.
Aroma of citrus, flowers, grass, fresh herbs, candy.
Tastes of flowers, minty herbs, grass, citrus, biscuit, citrus candy, spices.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, a bit dry, citric, grassy, herbal, piney, a bit spicy, a bit sweet malty.

Very nice. Fresh and hoppy, with nice citric and minty herbal notes. Drinks quite easy for the ABV. Far above their regular Pils stuff.

Draught at CBF Wien.
Black body, with a medium, creamy, dark beige head.
Aroma of toast, coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate, caramel, dark fruits, some vanilla, some tobacco.
Taste follows this, with more smooth coffee.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes smooth, roasty-bitter, medium dry, with coffee, cocoa, tobacco, some liquorice, some vanilla.

Tasty. Smooth, with lovely coffee and other dark roasty and sweet notes, but also quite easy to drink. The ABV is almost completely hidden. Great style example how I like it.

330 ml can from Firma Bier, bb 19/10/16. Thanks to Werckmeister!
Amber, hazy body, with a big, frothy, lacing, light yellow head.
Juicy aroma with lots of freshly peeled grapefruits, lemon zest, some passion fruit, some biscuit.
Taste is fresh and dry, also with a lot of grapefruit, lemon zest, citrus candy, grass, biscuit, subtle tropical fruits.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes dry, bitter, zesty, citric, a bit piney, a bit sweet malty, with a lot of lingering grapefruit.

Very nice. Quite simple, but very fresh and pleasantly dry, with loads of direct grapefruit notes. The grapefruit is really dominant, but still well balanced, with enough malt body and subtle hop notes. If you dont like grapefruits too much, this isnt for you propably. I really enjoyed it.

330 ml bottle, vintage 2013, bb 11/10/2015.
Dark copper-brown body, with a lot of floating yeast and a small, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of caramel, dried fruits, berries, cocoa, milk chocolate, some pices.
Tastes of dried fruits, cocoa, caramel, cinnamon, some toast, some wood, subtle alcohol.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes smooth, medium sweet, a bit dry, slightly roasty, with cocoa, wood, spices, fruits, some alcohol warmth.

Really tasty. Very smooth and perfectly balanced, complex, but also feels simple at the same time. Quite sweet, but not too much, with enough smooth, dry, slightly roasty notes. Alcohol is greatly hidden, just providing some warmth. Among my favourite Belgian dark strong ales Ive had so far.

330 ml bottle bb 27.03.2016.
Copper-brown, clear body, with a big, stable, creamy, strongly lacing, beige head.
Aroma of caramel, toast, dark berries, some bread, some grains, slight spices.
Tastes of toast, caramel, dark bread, dark fruits, honey, some chocolate, some spices.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes smooth, medium sweet, medium roasty, a bit bitter, toasty, bready, floral, a bit fruity.

Really nice. Smooth and quaffable, with very nice toasty and dark sweet notes. Among the best dark Bock beers from Austria in my opinion.

330 ml flip-top bottle from Hofladen Dazu, Wien, bb 09.06.16
Golden, clear body, with a big, unstable, frothy, lacing, white head.
Aroma of grass, flowers, grains, malt sweetness, some metal.
Tastes of hay, bread, grass, flowers, some herbs, some honey.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, medium dry, a bit sweet, floral, grassy, a bit herbal, with some lingering honey-notes.

Good. The nose isnt that good, with some unpleasant metallic notes. Taste is better though, with a good balance of grainy, floral and sweet notes. Overall nothing special, but still a quaffable, slightly above average Mrzen.

750 ml bottle from BeerLovers Vienna, vintage 2013 bottled 27. April 2015.
Dark golden to amber, moderate hazy body, with a medium, fizzy, fluffy, off-white head.
Aroma of barnyard, cheese, green apples, pears, wood, some ripe fruits, vinegar.
Taste is dry, sour and tart, but still well balanced, with wood, unripe pears, lots of green apples, sour citrus, funk, vinegar, some cheese, some basement.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, wooden, fruity, with pears, citrus, some cheese, long-lasting green apples.

Tasty. Straight, but complex at the same time, well balanced, with a lot of lovely sour fruits, especially distinct green apples. World-class and fresh to drink, not really hard to finish the whole 0.75 l bottle, but still not my favourite Cantillon.

355 ml bottle from BeerLovers Vienna, bottled 09/24/15
Dark copper body, with a small, fluffy, moderately lacing, beige head.
Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, caramel, cocoa, dried fruits, barrel, some alcohol.
Tastes of dried fruits, dark berries, cocoa, bourbon, wood, black tea, chocolate, liquorice, booze.
Medium to full, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes warm, medium boozy, a bit dry, medium sweet, a bit roasty, astringent, wooden, with bitter chocolate, some fruits, some bourbon.

Really tasty. Quite boozy, but not too overpowering, pleasantly warm. Very well integrated bourbon notes, not too dominant, adding another smooth layer. Overall a lovely, complex sipper and also a unique style example for those like me, who arent the biggest Scotch Ale fans normally.

330 ml bottle from Lebenswert Wien, bb 21.08.16
Amber, moderate hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of hay, bread, hemp, flowers, some herbs, some honey.
Tastes of bread, hay, honey, flowers, hemp, some herbs.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes herbal, grainy, bready, a bit sweet.

Nice one. Balanced, with the hemp well integrated and a good mix of sweet and hayish/bready notes. One of the better hemp beers Ive had, quaffable and refreshing.

500 ml can from Lidl, bb 31.03.2017
Golden, clear body, with a medium, unstable, frothy, lacing, off-white head.
Quite unpleasant aroma of corn, grains, cardboard, grass, herbs.
Taste follows this, with some more malt sweetness and slight metallic notes.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, a bit sweet, corny, grassy, herbal, with some cardboard.

Quite bad. Unpleasant, a bit dirty flavour, with the typical aromas I dont like in many lager beers. Not even refreshing, cant finish this.

500 ml can from Lidl, bb 03.2017
Golden, clear body, with a big, frothy, rocky, lacing, white head.
Aroma of grains, grass, cardboard, corn, malt sweetness.
Tastes of grass, flowers, honey, some bread, some herbs.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, medium sweet, floral, a bit herbal, slightly bready.

OK. Except some cardboard notes in the nose, quite clean and fresh. Actually drinks quite good for an alc free beer, Ive had much worse.

330 ml flip-top bottle from Hofladen Dazu, Wien, bb 26.05.16
Golden, clear body, with a big, frothy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of hay, bread, grass, flowers, some herbs.
Tastes of bread, hay, herbs, honey, grass, flowers, cereals, citrus.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bitter, herbal, floral, citric, grainy, a bit bready.

Nice one. The nose is more like a Mrzen, a lot of hay and bread. Taste is better, quite manifold and well balanced, with various hayish and floral notes, a good bitterness, but also some nice honey like notes. Overall not the very best Pils from Austria Ive had, but a really quaffable, quite above average one I would drink again.

330 ml bottle from BeerLovers Wien, bb 09/2016.
Amber, hazy body, with a big, stable, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of grapefruit, passion fruit, mango, peach, grass, earth, biscuit, some vanilla, some alcohol.
Tastes of grapefruit, citrus, biscuit, earth, some grass, some tropical fruits.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bitter, zesty, earthy, grassy, a bit malty, a bit alcohol warming.

Really nice. Very fruity and quite sweet nose, while the taste is more bitter, with some interesting earthy notes. Alcohol is noticeable, but doesnt drink too heavy. Overall not outstanding maybe and not among my favourite style examples from Austria, but enjoyable nonetheless.

Draught at the brewpub.
Amber, clear body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of grapefruit, orange, grass, passion fruit, biscuit.
Tastes of grapefruit, passion fruit and some other tropical fruits, orange, grass, biscuit.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes bitter, moderate dry, zesty, grassy, a bit herbal, a bit malty.

Nice one. Fully aromatic and with a nice hop bite, but still well drinkable and balanced, with a good malt body. Not my favourite IPA from Austria, but among the better ones.

Draught at the brewpub.
Dark amber, moderate hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, yellowish head.
Aroma of citrus, orange, passion fruit, red berries, some grass, caramel, some bubblegum.
Taste follows this pretty much.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, a bit sweet, fruity, zesty, a bit grassy.

Nice one. Quite simple, but easy drinkable and well balanced, with a sweet malt body and enough hops. Nothing outstanding, but really quaffable.

500 ml flip-top bottle bb 21.05.16 from Lebenswert Wien.
Dark golden to amber, moderate hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of hay, bread, flowers, grass, some honey.
Taste is a bit lighter, with hay, flowers, herbs, bread, some spices, honey.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, herbal, floral, bready, a bit spicy, a bit alcohol warming.

Nice one. Quaffable, with nice rustic, hayish notes. A bit stronger, as a good Mrzen should be. Quite above average style example, while not among my favourite ones from Austria.

beer_brewer_name: Malt n More Trading - Mlzerei Plohberger
review_blob:
330 ml bottle from a supermarket, bb 28.01.17
Dark golden, clear body, with a small, frothy, off-white head.
Quite ugly aroma of corn, artificial sweet notes, grass, some metallic notes.
Taste is even worse, with an artifical, almost chemical sweetness, rubber, with grass, flowers, herbs.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes soft, artificially sweet again, moderate bitter, grassy, herbal.

Wow, this is really disgusting. Tastes very strange, hard to finish just a few sips. One of the worst beers from Austria Ive had so far.

330 ml can from BeerLovers Wien, bb 12/01/17.
Dark amber to copper, hazy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, resin, passion fruit, pineapple, grass, biscuit.
Tastes of grapefruit, grass, earth, resin, some pine, tropical fruits in the background, biscuit.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes bitter, dry, pretty piney, zesty, herbal, a bit fruity, a bit malty, quite alcohol warming.

Really nice. Fruity nose, while the taste is bitter and dry, with a lot of pine in the finish. Quite heavy and a bit harsh, maybe slightly too much, I prefer it more balanced. Overall another enjoyable IPA by Mikkeller, but yet they didnt accomplish a world-class example of this style in my opinion.

330 ml bottle from a supermarket.
Pinkish, clear body, with a small, fizzy, off-white, slightly pink head.
Aroma of sweet red berries, perfume, candy, some sweet apples.
Tastes of sweet red berries, apples, sugar, some fruity sourness.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes sweet, a bit sour, a bit dry, fruity, sugary.

OK. Pretty sweet, like lemonade, overall too sweet for me. Nice berries and apples though and drinks fresh and easy, but the regular Goldkehlchen is better in my opinion.

330 ml bottle at 12.2% ABV, bottled 01.03.2016, courtesy of Werkmeister, thanks!
Dark copper, clear body, with a small, creamy, beige head.
Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, marzipan, cocoa, alcohol.
Tastes of almonds and other nuts, dried fruits, berries, caramel, cocoa, some tobacco, booze.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes boozy, sweet, moderate roasty, a bit dry, with nuts, cocoa, some tobacco.

Tasty. Boozy and heavy, with lots of lovely sweet layers, but well balanced, never too sweet. Liked this much better than the Nussknacker, complex and really smooth to drink.

237 ml can as "Efes Xtra Shot" bb 26.06.16, courtesy of Werckmeister, many thanks!
Deep golden, moderate hazy body, with a big, fluffy, lacing, white head.
Aroma of grains, cardboard, honey like malt sweetness, corn, some alcohol.
Tastes sweet and quite boozy, with about the same aromas and some more herbs.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes boozy, sweet, a bit herbal, with grains, herbs, cardboard, corn, honey.

Doesnt taste dirty or something, typical macro lager, except that its much too boozy, much too sweet and much too flat. My first Malt Liquor to complete all styles, not sure Ill have another one...

375 ml bottle bought at Ottakringer Braukulturwochen 2015, bb 2026.
Dark copper-brown body, with almost no head.
Aroma of barrel, chocolate, red wine, dark fruits, coconut, alcohol.
Tastes of barrel, coconut, red wine, chocolate, cocoa, dark fruits, booze.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes boozy, sweet, wooden, vinous, with cocoa, dark fruits, subtle coffee.

Nice one, although I was expecting a bit more. Pretty boozy, with quite dominant wine barrel notes. Also with some nice smooth dark malts though. Overall not among my favourite beers from this brewery.
beer_name: Toccalmatto Bedda Matri Marsala Wine Barrel Aged

review_blob:
310 ml bottle bb Jan 2019 shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Dark brown body, with a small, creamy, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of whiskey barrel, coconut, dark chocolate, caramel, dark berries, some coffee, alcohol.
Tastes of booze, dominant whiskey, barrel, coconut, dark chocolate, coffee, some liquorice.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes boozy, quite dry, with a lot of whiskey, wood, cocoa, some coffee, some liquorice.

Nice one, although not outstanding. Not very well balanced, with too much booze and whiskey, especially in the taste. Nice dark, smooth malts from the background though. Overall good, but an example of too much barrel aging in my opinion.
beer_name: Tupiniquim Monjolo Imperial Porter BA Wiskey

review_blob:
330 ml bottle bb Jan 2018 from my EU Local Swap 1/2016 sender omhper, thanks!
Dark brown body, with a tiny, brown head.
Aroma of coconut, barrel, melting chocolate, some vanilla, dark fruits, caramel, slight liquorice.
Tastes of barrel, cocoa, coffee, cocos, dark chocolate, dark fruits, alcohol.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes a bit soft, alcohol warming, wooden, medium roasty, with cocoa, some coffee, coconut.

Very nice. Lovely, dense nose, with barrel notes and smooth dark malts. Tastes a bit light bodied though, but with quite some alcohol. Not an outstanding style example, but an enjoyable sipper.

330 ml bottle bb 06/2016 shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Dark brown body, with a big, dense, lacing, coffee-colored head.
Aroma of toast, dark bread, toffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits, some vanilla, some coffee.
Tastes of coffee, milk chocolate, caramel, toast, vanilla, dark fruits, some liquorice.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty-sweet, with cocoa, coffee, toast, some liquorice.

Very nice. Quite dense and aromatic, while a bit too sweet for my liking. Still with nice roasty and toasty notes and drinks smooth. Not among my favourite style examples, but enjoyable.

500 ml bottle bb 2016.05.15 shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Copper, hazy body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, resin, passion fruit, caramel, candy.
Taste follows this pretty much.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes bitter-sweet, a bit dry, zesty, malty, fruity, a bit alcohol warming.

Nice one. Clean, with nice fruit notes and a smooth malt body, but a bit simple and also too sweet for my taste. Maybe it isnt fresh enough, while it is still an enjoyable beer.

500 ml bottle bb 18.06.2016 shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Almost black body, with a medium, dense, lacing, dark beige head.
Aroma with lots of espresso and coffee beans, some dark chocolate, some toast.
Tastes of espresso, coffee beans, caramel, dark chocolate, some toast, some dark fruits.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty-bitter, medium dry, with a lot of coffee again, some liquorice, some cocoa powder.

Very nice. Not sure if this should be categorised as a Dunkel, as this is all about the added coffee, with the typical aromas of this style very much in the background. Quite simple, but with lovely, direct coffee notes for coffee-lovers like me.

500 ml bottle bb 05/16 from my EU Local Swap 1/2016 sender omhper, thanks!
Dark copper body, with a medium, fluffy, lacing, light beige head.
Aroma of dominant peat, wood, some spices, some caramel.
Tastes also of dominant peat, smoked wood, spices, caramel, some dark fruits.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smokey, wooden, dry, a bit sweet, a bit fruity.

OK, but not my cup of tea, as I dont like peat. The nose is almost only peat, taste is a bit more varied, with some dark malts and fruit notes. If you like peat dominated beers, this is perfect, but Im not one of those people.
UPDATED: APR 3, 2016

330 ml bottle from Biervana Mnchen, bb Jul. 16.
Deep copper-brown body, with a big, creamy, moderately lacing, beige head.
Aroma of sweet berries, grass, herbs, toast, caramel.
Tastes of caramel, sweet fruits, grass, bread, citrus, candy, some herbs.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, zesty, a bit piney, grassy, a bit herbal, moderate sweet.

Nice one. Well balanced between sweet fruits, smooth malts and medium bitter hoppy notes, although the hops are a bit in the background. Interesting beer, but not the best one from both brewers.

330 ml bottle from Biervana Mnchen, bb 07/07/16.
Almost black body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, beige head.
Aroma of grapefruit, resin, pine, passion fruit, berries, chocolate, some coffee, liquorice.
Taste follows this, a bit lighter, but with the blueberries coming a bit through.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes bitter, medium dry, zesty, piney, moderate roasty, a bit fruity, a bit sweet.

Very nice. Lovely nose, very fruity and diverse. Taste is a bit light, while also nice. Maybe too less roasty. Overall a really enjoyable, quite easy drinkable BIPA, while not among my favourite ones.

330 ml bottle bb 07/2018 shared by Werckmeister, thanks!
Dark amberto copper, hazy body, with a medium, dissipating, fizzy, light beige head.
Aroma of dried fruits, spices, flowers, some barnyard, some cheese, bread, some pepper.
Tastes of lemongrass, herbs, apples, spices, flowers, yeast, bread, wheat, some pepper.
Light, slick mouthfeel, with a quite lively carbonation.
Finishes dry, a bit bitter, spicy, herbal, floral, yeasty, wheaty, a bit bready.

Good. Quite variant, even a bit complex, with a mix of Saison and Hefeweizenaromas. Drinks easy and fresh. Nothing special overall, but interesting.

500 ml flip-top bottle bought in Steyr, bb 15.5.16
Amber-orange, hazy body, with a medium, fluffy, yellowish head.
Aroma of fruit yoghurt, sweet bread, some grains, some flowers.
Tastes of citrus, grass, flowers, some hay, some herbs, some bread.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, grassy, floral, a bit herbal, a bit fruity.

OK. The nose is quite strange, with dominant yoghurt, propably not intended. Taste is a bit better, with some nice fruity and floral notes. Overall not a bad beer, but a bit chaotic maybe.

330 ml bottle from end of 2014, bb 29.10.15
Medium gusher. Amber, hazy body, with floating yeast particles and a medium, fluffy, moderately lacing, light beige head.
Aroma of honey, ripe fruits, bread, oat, some berries, flowers, some citrus.
Taste is a bit lighter, with about the same aromas and subtle alcohol.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes medium alcohol warming, quite soft, floral, a bit fruity, with some some grains and lingering honey notes.

Good. Interesting, diverse nose, with a good mix of sweet and fruity notes. Taste is a bit too light for my liking, while still good. Overall it has more character than many other style examples, but still not among the best ones Ive had.

330 ml bottle from BeerLovers Wien, bb 28.10.16
Golden, clear body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, white head.
Aroma of honey, flowers, grains, grass, some bread, some sweet ripe fruits, some citrus.
Tastes of flowers, grass, grains, citrus, honey, spices, some herbs, some sweet fruits, some alcohol.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with an average cabonation.
Finishes alcohol warming, bitter, quite dry, hoppy, floral, spicy, grassy, a bit sweet.

Good, but not so special. A bit hoppier than usual for this style, with nice floral notes and a bitter finish. Still quite simple overall, while well balanced. Not among my favourite Hofstettner bock beers.

375 ml waxed bottle #0030, bb 02/2020, from my EU Local Swap 1/2016 sender omhper, thanks!
Almost black body, with a medium, creamy, moderately lacing, dark beige to brown head.
Aroma of cocoa, coffee, liquorice, dried fruits, wood, subtle smoke.
Taste follows this, with more roasty coffee and some melting chocolate.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty-bitter, quite dry, with liquorice, wood, coffee, some cocoa, subtle dark fruits, some alcohol warmth.

A bit light bodied for the style and not very complex, but still a very nice, aromatic, strong Stout. Well integrated coffee, providing a dry, wooden roastiness. The ABV is greatly hidden, drinks quite smooth. Not among my favourite style examples Ive had from Sweden, but enoyable nonetheless.
